data.title: Been coming for years
data.text: Consistent good food and and friendly wait staff. The breakfast is what we usually come for, and we usually always see the same customers. Which says a lot about the place.

data.title: Great value
data.text: Great value meals that include, soup, salad,  veg , potato choice  and fresh rolls in price of meal ( note includes all not a choice of). Friendly service. Good choice for a no frills night out.

data.title: Good enough family diner
data.text: One of my favorite go to places for pancake dinners. The have a pretty typical diner menu with some greek dishes added. I have dined at 3 different locations and never have tried anything I would not have again. My favorite part of the menu is the breakfast selections (served all day) but have tried some of the sandwich and salad selections. If you like a good chef salad this is one of the best. It has a large amount of toppings and is not primarily lettuce like so many places serve. The service has always been good.

data.title: Your typical family diner
data.text: Jims is a typical family diner. It has a large menu and good prices. They breakfast time is always busy but the food is good. The noise level can get a bit annoying at times.

data.title: Good food!
data.text: Good food, family owned business, full of regulars that love to come back because of the quality of service and food.  Good size portions are served.

data.title: Decent food, great service, great value
data.text: We weren't even looking for it--we had someplace else in mind when this restaurant popped up on our GPS and it looked interesting.  Kind of a Shoney's/Perkins/Friendly's vibe but definitely local and with bigger menu.  Friday evening and busy but we were seated immediately.  Our server was great--quick, efficient, and ever-smiling--and our orders and food brought out quickly.  The food itself was OK but not outstanding, with two exceptions: the pork souvlaki (which was itself an unusual selection for a restaurant of this type) was very good, and our dessert, the homemade bread pudding, was delicious (it would have been even better without all the whipped cream and caramel sauce).  The big surprise was the bill--amazingly low for the amount of food we got.  For instance:  a 7-ounce steak, salad, side and dessert for $11?  What a deal!

data.title: We love their Greek Dressing
data.text: We come here for breakfast and the greek salad dressing! The value is great and the service is always good as well as the food. It's a hometown restaurant with yummy food!

user_location.name: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States

data.title: Great service good food.
data.text: This place always has good service and the foods not bad either. We come about once or twice a month and will continue to do so. I recommend the chicken fried steak or Cajun chicken pasta.

data.title: Typical U.S. family diner.  Good food, easy on wallet
data.text: Diner atmosphere.  Lots of variety.  My meal was very good.  Had breakfast for dinner.  Good prices.  Served in a timely manor.  Every staff person was very kind.  I'd stop again.

data.title: Cheap breakfast with lots of food
data.text: Typical diner food. Service is always fast & efficient. Always busy on Sunday mornings.

data.title: Never again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
data.text: We ordered the 'prime rib' meal, end cut.  When it arrived it was pale, cold and tasteless.  It was sent back to be 'fixed' and the same piece of meat was returned after being microwaved.  When I complained that one, it was not an end cut and that it was totally unacceptable.  I was rudely informed that it was indeed an end cut and that was that.   After a confrontation with the waitress that gave no satisfaction we indicated that we would instead choose to leave rather than accept a fully substandard meal.  It was a uniquely horrible experience and will NEVER go back there and will take every opportunity (ergo this rating/review) tell anyone and everyone what poor food and what they pass off as 'service'.
